COVID-19

Passengers on flight with first Scots coronavirus patient were 'not traced'

June 8, 2020

https://www.thescottishsun.co.uk/news/5676145/coronavirus-scotland-passenger-edinburgh-flight-covid-19-traced/

The Daily Record reports:

PASSENGERS who shared a flight to Edinburgh with Scotland’s first confirmed coronavirus patient were not traced because public health officials did not think he was infectious, it’s been claimed.

The country’s first Covid-19 victim came down with a fever days after returning home from Italy on February 26.

The 51-year-old’s case was revealed on March 2 when ex-chief medic Catherine Calderwood said health protection teams would do a “detailed history” of people he’d come into contact with.

Call for apology after 'misleading information' sent to Scots shielding at home

June 8, 2020

https://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/news/politics/call-scottish-government-apologise-after-22153071

The Daily Record reports:

Almost 18,000 Scots shielding at home were sent a letter by health bosses telling them incorrect information on when they could go outside.

The National: COViD-19 Crisis Boosts Independence

June 6, 2020

Today’s National newspaper leads with the headline “Covid-19 Crisis Confidence Boost for Indy Scotland”.

In a word: disgusting. The Nationalists have certainly taken “don’t let a crisis go to waste” to a new low. As of today, 2415 people in Scotland have died from Coronavirus, many of whose deaths were caused by the Scottish government discharging elderly patients from hospitals to care homes without testing, BUT IT’S ALL RIGHT BECAUSE IT FURTHERS OUR GOAL OF INDEPENDENCE.

Coronavirus: More than 200 died after first falling sick in Scottish hospitals

June 6, 2020

https://www.heraldscotland.com/news/18500611.nearly-1-000-people-got-coronavirus-hospital-conditions/

The Herald says:

ALMOST a thousand patients have developed coronavirus - and more than 200 of them have died - after being admitted to hospital for other conditions, the Scottish Government has confirmed.

It means one in eight of all Covid deaths in hospital in Scotland involved someone who first fell sick while being treated on a non-Covid ward.

Report warned Scotland was ill-prepared to deal with a disease outbreak

June 6, 2020

https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/coronavirus-in-scotland-report-warned-scotland-was-ill-prepared-to-deal-with-a-disease-outbreak-58xmlmktt

The Times says:

In 2016 Dr Gregor Smith, Scotland’s chief medical officer, led the Silver Swan planning exercise, which led to officials fearing services would struggle to deliver. It said: “Given the pressures on services, people are working in crisis every day and senior managers need to recognise this.”

Scots should call police if neighbours have house parties this weekend

June 5, 2020

https://www.thescottishsun.co.uk/news/5670870/coronavirus-scotland-police-neighbours-house-party/

SCOTS should call the cops if neighbours host house parties this weekend, the nation’s police chief has said.

Chief constable Iain Livingstone made a desperate plea for people not to gather indoors with loved ones, even if it’s raining.
